sentences: Ma pean selle tööga kiiresti peast lahti saama.
Ta ei saa aru, mis temaga peast sassi läheb.
Mul on sellest murest juba peast välja aetud.
context: The word 'peast' in Estonian can have several meanings depending on the context. It often refers to the head or mind, but it can also mean 'to get rid of something', 'to figure out', or 'to go crazy'. It is commonly used in expressions related to thinking, understanding, and dealing with problems.
